explanation: Agent A's report is correct in the sense claimed. MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2 forbids executed operations whose removal would not affect program behaviour. If in the project configuration mhd_assert is defined as a no-op (for example #define mhd_assert(x) ((void)0)), each mhd_assert(...) call in digest_reset becomes an executed no-op statement whose removal would not change program behaviour — i.e. dead code — so the project would violate Rule 2.2. Conversely, if mhd_assert expands to a real runtime check (with observable behaviour on failure), then those statements are not dead and do not violate Rule 2.2. Whether a violation exists therefore depends on how mhd_assert is defined in the project configuration; the agent's conditional claim is correct.
